Look beneath the surface. That's what NBN did, with a GoPro in hand. NBN came together to capture the moments underwater, swimming below the surface of SPAC's pool and immersing themselves in the waters of Lake Michigan. This project was made possible by the NBN Alumni Special Features Grant*, which was funded by the generous donations of NBN alumni. Dive in and submerge yourself.







Lake Michigan



Photos by Madhuri Sathish, Alex Furuya and Wei Wei



One (rare) sunny afternoon, the NBN Photo team went on a field trip to the beach to play with their new GoPro. They stuck the camera underwater and captured footage. This was the result.







Swimming



Photos and footage by Elizabeth Santoro



Practicing in the off season, Northwestern Women's Swimming and Diving finished the 2014-2015 season placing 10th at the Big Bend Championship back in February. Over the course of the season, the team made the cuts for "B" NCAA qualifying standards in eight events. At the TYR Invitational in Evanston, the team also set a new Norris Aquatics Center 400 medley relay pool record of 3:41.95, erasing Stanford's 17-year-old record of 3:43.10 from 1997. The team also established new pool records in the 200 fly, 100 free and 400 free relay.









Diving



Photos and footage by Jesse Itskowitz

Outdoor Sports



Photos and footage by Lily Allen



When you're napping by the Lakefill, you can often see Lake Michigan dotted with sailboats. More than likely, this is Northwestern's Sailing Team. We had a member of the team take a GoPro out to Lake Michigan. However, that day, there was no wind, but they were allowed to go take equipment on the boathouse, and they went kayaking and paddleboarding. Here is the view on Lake Michigan.
